    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)

      • findValidColumn

        public static int findValidColumn(int row,
                                  int[] queenPositions)
        Returns the valid column to place the queen given the integer argument and the integer array argument.

        If the row is negative or greater than or equal to the integer array's size or if every column is invalid, the column will default to -1.

        Parameters:
        row - queen's row
        queenPositions - array of queens positions
        Returns:
        the valid column for the queen in the specified row

      • isValidQueenPosition

        public static boolean isValidQueenPosition(int row,
                                           int column,
                                           int[] queenPositions)
        Returns if the queen placed at (row, column) is valid given the integer arguments and the integer array argument.

        If the row and/or column is negative or greater than or equal to the integer array's size, the placement of the queen will default to being invalid.

        A valid queen position is not in the same row, column, and diagonal of the other queens' positions in the integer array.

        Parameters:
        row - queen's row
        column - queen's column
        queenPositions - array of queens positions
        Returns:
        true if the (row, column) is a valid position for placing the queen. Otherwise, false.

      • printChessboard

        public static void printChessboard(int[] queenPositions)
        Prints the chessboard with the valid queens given by the integer array argument.
        Parameters:
        queenPositions - array of valid queens positions
